core_meaning.legge_1899_public_domain: Sui indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. But it will be advan tageous to be firm and correct. There will (then) be no error. 1. The first line, undivided, shows us one chang ing the object of his pursuit; but if he be firm and correct, there will be good fortune. Going beyond (his own) gate to find associates, he will achieve merit. 2. The second line, divided, shows us one who cleaves to the little boy, and lets go the man of age and experience. 3. The third line, divided, shows us one who cleaves to the man of age and experience, and lets go the little boy. Such following will get what it seeks; but it will be advantageous to adhere to what is firm and correct. 4. The fourth line, undivided, shows us one followed and obtaining (adherents). Though he be firm and correct, there will be evil. If he be sincere (however) in his course, and make that evident, into what error will he fall ? Hence he is represented as suffering from a chronic complaint, but nevertheless he does not die. See Appendix II on the line. Line 6, at the very top or end of the hexagram, is weak, and its subject is all but lost. Still even for him there is a chance of safety, if he will but change. 5. The fifth line, undivided, shows us (the ruler) sincere in (fostering all) that is excellent. There will be good fortune. 6. The topmost line, divided, shows us (that sin cerity) firmly held and clung to, yea, and bound fast. (We see) the king with it presenting his offerings on the western mountain. XVII. Sui symbolises the idea of following, It g said to follow Yfl, the symbol of harmony and satisfaction. Where there are these conditions men are sure to follow; nor will they follow those in whom they have no complacency. The hexagram include*, the cases where one follows others, and where others follow him; and the auspice of great progress and success is due to this flexi bility wid applicability of it. The weak lines ought to follow it; but here it is below them, in the lowest place of the figure. This gives rise to the representation of one changing his pursuit, Still through the native vigour indicated by the line being strong, and in its correct place, its subject will be fortunate. Going beyond his gate to find associates indicates his public spirit, and superiority to selfish considerations. Line 2 is weak. core_meaning.normalized_summary: Following done well is not blind obedience. You align yourself with what is right, and others then align with you. Progress comes from choosing worthy guidance and holding to correct conduct.

translations.text: 1. The first line, undivided, shows us one chang ing the object of his pursuit; but if he be firm and correct, there will be good fortune. Going beyond (his own) gate to find associates, he will achieve merit.
初九：官有渝，貞吉。出門交有功。

lines.normalized_meaning: You pivot. You shift who/what you follow. As long as you stay principled and seek allies beyond your own gate, that change earns real credit.

translations.text: 2. The second line, divided, shows us one who cleaves to the little boy, and lets go the man of age and experience.

lines.normalized_meaning: If you attach yourself to someone immature, you lose the seasoned, reliable ally. Favoring the small costs you the strong.

translations.text: 3. The third line, divided, shows us one who cleaves to the man of age and experience, and lets go the little boy. Such following will get what it seeks; but it will be advantageous to adhere to what is firm and correct.
六三：系丈夫，失小子。隨有求得，利居貞。

lines.normalized_meaning: Following mature strength instead of childish influence brings results. Stay steady, stay upright, and you benefit.

九四：隨有獲，貞凶。有孚在道，以明，何咎？

lines.normalized_meaning: Being followed gives you power — and risk. Even if you’re correct, jealousy and suspicion arise. Only visible sincerity and clarity of motive keeps you safe.

translations.text: 5. The fifth line, undivided, shows us (the ruler) sincere in (fostering all) that is excellent. There will be good fortune.

lines.normalized_meaning: True leadership: wholehearted faith in what is genuinely good. When the center is sincere, good fortune follows.

lines.normalized_meaning: Following reaches ritual-level commitment: loyalty is bound, formal, consecrated under royal authority. Devotion becomes duty.
